sub_title: Assistant professor disaster risk and resilience, humanitarian technical shelter advisor
summary: I am Assistant Professor of Disaster Resilience and Humanitarian Assistance. Aiming to scale up recovery assistance by understanding the impact of measures. Currently working on behavioural models for reconstruction decision-maki g, platform for digital tools for resilient housing, circularity of emergency shelters (design, procurement and after life), flood resilient housing and settlements in Nepal, climate shelters in Valencia, flood prevention in Cox. I have a track record in the field of disaster risk reduction, disaster resilience, humanitarian assistance, self-recovery, and decision-making. I have studied and worked in humanitarian assistance/aid, post-disaster reconstruction, shelter and settlement, migration in Europe, and adaptation to climate change of the built environment for more than 10 years, especially in hazard prone areas in low-income countries. I lecture on humanitarian engineering, disaster risk reduction, disaster resilience, methodology, and organize in-situ/fieldwork research for students.

profile_positions.description:
- Working on the VENI project, Enabling vulnerable communities to build back safer
- Member of the Centre for Disaster Resilience
- Developing a new Master's program in Humanitarian Engineering
- Member of the Technical Working group for Flood Resilience in Nepal in collaboration with HRRP
- Organizer of the NEEDS conference 2023
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor post-disaster reconstruction decision-making

profile_positions.description: Consulting for regions and cities in Europe on the EU mission Adaptation to Climate Change. Responsible for assistance to the region of Varna, the city of Valencia and the municipality of Cox dealing with flood, drought, and heat risks.
profile_positions.title: Advisor Urban Adaptation to Climate Change

company.name: Avans research group: New materials and their applications

profile_positions.company: Avans research group: New materials and their applications
profile_positions.description:
• Project Leader of Circular Emergency Hospital project aiming to inform circular design and procurement of tents coordinating a team of researchers and students, in collaboration with Doctors without Borders, Wijnroemer Relief Goods.
• Project Leader of 3D printed bridge out of post-consumer plastics, coordinating a team of lecturers, researchers and students, in collaboration with the province Noord-Brabant, Municipality of Den Bosch, Sparklin Plastics, Spark Makerszone. 
• Initiating and writing grant applications for the use of new materials in emergency response.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader and researcher

profile_positions.description: Yearly seminar“Community knowledge adoption in post-disaster reconstruction” for the Master City Resilience and Management.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
• Guest-editor of two special issues in Disaster Prevention and Management: Emerging voices and pathways to inclusive disaster studies. For these unique special issues, we connected early career researchers to peers and experienced disaster scientists as their mentors. Work is also discussed on 6 episodes of the popular podcast called Disasters Deconstructed. 
• Publishing several articles linked to post-disaster reconstruction in Nepal and the Philippines.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
• Supervising bachelor, master, and PDEng students for (temporary) buildings and settlements for disaster and migration. 
• International Development and Sustainability (master)
• Architecture and Technology (bachelor).
• Project Building Technology "DIY home for new Dutchies" (master)
• Graduation project "A public building for refugees in Zaatari, Jordan" (master)
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Promotors: Prof. Dr. Ir. Jos Lichtenberg and Prof. Dr. Ir. André Jorissen

Guiding a team of thesis students directly related to the doctoral study:
- Master thesis: Erika Palmieri, Benjamin Schep, Enrico Dainese
- Bachelor thesis: Ranon Caris, Gijs van Duren, Sandra van Ekeren, Jim de Kort, Jason Ramos Silva, Dennis Nijnatten, Bart van Jole, Lucy Woodley, Vivian Tran, Janice Wu (among many others).
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description: Product developer and design of 120m2 modular multipurpose community shelter and rapidly deployable water tower kit in European project S(p)eedkits with field tests in Senegal and Mongolia, in collaboration with Shelter Reseach Unit from the IFRC, Medicins Sans Frontieres and WRG. Both types are in use by NGO's now. S(p)eedkits is an European collaboration between Universities, NGO's and companies who work together to develop innovative prototypes for emergency response based on demands from the field.
profile_positions.title: Emergency shelter and Watsan Researcher for S(p)eedkits

profile_positions.description: Strategy development, connecting humanitarian research needs to the curriculum of students, organization of events focussing on the role of technology in low-income countries, granting scholarships for internships abroad, representing the built environment in the university-wide organization, overseeing the content of the master certificate program.
profile_positions.title: Daily Board member

profile_positions.title: Senior lecturer

profile_positions.description: Multidisciplinary graduation program for the 3 educational programs of the Academy of Built Environment and Infrastructure, civil engineering, architecture, urban development. Managing the online and offline preparation of research projects including inspiration sessions, matchmaking between students, the formation of thematic graduation studios, meet-ups with the building industry and preparatory research workshops.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator graduation school

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the management and coordination of the educational program including two multidisciplinary tracks of 30 ECTS: (Inter)national Disaster, Migration and Resilience and (Inter)national Disaster Resilience and Climate Change. Design of program structure and content development, financial management, developing and leading new initiatives and acquisition of consultancy assignments for students, international partnership with humanitarian organizations and universities, study trip organization volunteering in migration response, international student exchange program, planning online and offline classes for a team of 15 lecturers, student guidance. 45-70 students yearly.
profile_positions.title: Director and initator Disruptive Events

profile_positions.description:
Adoption of hazard-resistant construction knowledge in post-disaster reconstruction
Member Research Group Innovation Building Process and Technology
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: Full-time, based in Sydney for 5 months. Taught a graduate course in humanitarian engineering, and reviewed student theses in the field of post-disaster housing in the Humanitarian Frontiers lab. Established research collaboration on reconstruction projects in the Philippines and Nepal.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Fellow and Guest Lecturer at Humanitarian Engineering

profile_positions.description: Research leader, large scale mixed-method study of earthquake resistant construction knowledge adoption, across 25 remote communities in Nepal following the 2015 earthquake. Comparison of communities with different levels of humanitarian technical assistance.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher Nepal

profile_positions.description: Research leader, small scale mixed-method study 6 self-recovering communities in the Philippines, following Typhoon Haiyan (2013). Evaluation of factors and actors of the adoption of typhoon resistant construction knowledge.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher Philippines
